ai.summary: Derwent Valley and Reservoir Walk is a 13.3 km moderate hike in the UK, offering scenic reservoir and valley views along water-side paths. The route is suitable for walkers with moderate fitness and comfortable footwear, with mostly flat to gently undulating terrain and some short rises.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail follows well-maintained paths and towpaths beside the Derwent Valley and reservoir. Expect mostly flat to gently rolling ground, with occasional muddy or uneven sections after rain, and a few grassy or stepped patches. Shared-use paths with cyclists are common in parts.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Trails can be muddy or slippery when wet; wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers. Stay aware of cyclists on shared paths, keep a safe distance from the water's edge, and carry a map or GPS. Let someone know your planned route and turnaround time. Bring water and snacks, and carry a small first aid kit.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Layered clothing (base layer, fleece, waterproof outer layer)
Headlamp or flashlight (for low light conditions)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; winter hikes are possible with daylight and weather considerations, but may be more exposed and require extra caution.

seo.title: Derwent Valley and Reservoir Walk – 13.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a 13.3 km moderate hike through the Derwent Valley and reservoir area in the UK. Enjoy water-side paths, gentle gradients, and scenic valley views.
